010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
033 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
034 * object structures. 
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
036 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
037 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
038 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
039 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
040 * 
041 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
042 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.
043 * Some methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author W. Burger
047 * @version 2022/08/29
048 */
049public abstract class Matrix {
050        
051        private Matrix() {}
052        
053        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
054        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
055        
056        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
057        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
058        
059        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
060        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
061        
062        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
063        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
064        
065        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
066        
067        /**
068         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
069         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
070         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
071         * </p>
072         * <pre>
073         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
074         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
075         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
076         * <p>
077         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
078         * </p>
079         * 
080         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
081         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
082         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
083         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
084         */
085        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
086                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
087                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
088                        return A;
089                }
090                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
091                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
092                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
093                }
094                
095                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
096                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
097                                A[r][c] = values[i];
098                                i++;
099                        }
100                }               
101                return A;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * <p>
106         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
107         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
108         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
109         * </p>
110         * <pre>
111         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
112         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
113         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
114         * <p>
115         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
116         * </p>
117         * 
118         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
119         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
120         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
121         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
122         */
123        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
124                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
125                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
126                        return A;
127                }
128                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
129                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
130                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
131                }       
132                
133                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
134                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
135                                A[r][c] = values[i];
136                                i++;
137                        }
138                }               
139                return A;
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * <p>
144         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
145         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
146         * </p>
147         * <pre>
148         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
149         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
150         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
151         * <p>
152         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
153         * </p>
154         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
155         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
156         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
157         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
158         */
159        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
160                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
161        }
162        
163
164        /**
165         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
166         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
167         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
168         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
169         *  
170         * @param A a matrix
171         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
172         */
173        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
174                final int rows = A.length;
175                final int cols = A[0].length;
176                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
177                int i = 0;
178                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
179                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
180                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
181                                i++;
182                        }
183                }
184                return vals;
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
189         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
190         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
191         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
192         *  
193         * @param A a matrix
194         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
195         */
196        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
197                final int rows = A.length;
198                final int cols = A[0].length;
199                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
200                int i = 0;
201                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
202                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
203                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
204                                i++;
205                        }
206                }
207                return vals;
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
212         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
213         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
214         *  
215         * @param A a matrix
216         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
217         */
218        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
219                return flatten(A.getData());
220        }
221        
222        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
223        
224        /**
225         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
226         * specified values.
227         * 
228         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
229         * @return a {@code double[]}
230         */
231        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
232                return values;
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
237         * specified values.
238         * 
239         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
240         * @return a {@code float[]}
241         */
242        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
243                return values;
244        }
245        
246        /**
247         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
248         * specified {@code double} values.
249         * 
250         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
251         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
252         */
253        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
254                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
255//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
256        }
257        
258        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
259        
260        /**
261         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
262         * specified length.
263         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
264         * @param length the length of the vector
265         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
266         */
267        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
268                if (length < 1)
269                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
270                return new double[length];
271        }
272        
273        /**
274         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
275         * specified size.
276         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
277         * @param size the size of the matrix
278         * @return an identity matrix
279         */
280        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
281                if (size < 1)
282                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
283                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
284                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
285                        A[i][i] = 1;
286                }
287                return A;
288        }
289        
290        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
291
292        /**
293         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
294         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
295         * @return the number of rows
296         */
297        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
298                return A.length;
299        }
300        
301        
302        /**
303         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
304         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
305         * @return the number of columns
306         */
307        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
308                return A[0].length;
309        }
310        
311        /**
312         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
313         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
314         * @return the number of rows
315         */
316        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
317                return A.length;
318        }
319        
320        /**
321         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
322         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
323         * @return the number of columns
324         */
325        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
326                return A[0].length;
327        }
328        
329        /**
330         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
331         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
332         * @return the number of rows
333         */
334        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
335                return A.getRowDimension();
336        }
337        
338        /**
339         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
340         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
341         * @return the number of columns
342         */
343        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
344                return A.getColumnDimension();
345        }
346        
347        // Extract rows or columns
348        
349        /**
350         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
351         * as a {@code double} vector.
352         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
353         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
354         * @return a {@code double} vector
355         */
356        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
357                return A[r].clone();
358        }
359        
360        /**
361         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
362         * as a {@code float} vector.
363         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
364         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
365         * @return a {@code float} vector
366         */
367        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
368                return A[r].clone();
369        }
370        
371        /**
372         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
373         * as a {@code double} vector.
374         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
375         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
376         * @return a {@code double} vector
377         */
378        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
379                final int rows = A.length;
380                double[] col = new double[rows];
381                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
382                        col[r] = A[r][c];
383                }
384                return col;
385        }
386        
387        /**
388         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
389         * as a {@code float} vector.
390         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
391         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
392         * @return a {@code float} vector
393         */
394        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
395                final int rows = A.length;
396                float[] col = new float[rows];
397                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
398                        col[r] = A[r][c];
399                }
400                return col;
401        }
402        
403        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
404        
405        /**
406         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
407         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
408         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
409         */
410        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
411                final int nCols = A[0].length;
412                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
413                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
414                                return false;
415                        }
416                }
417                return true;
418        }
419        
420        /**
421         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
422         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
423         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
424         */
425        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
426                final int nCols = A[0].length;
427                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
428                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
429                                return false;
430                        }
431                }
432                return true;
433        }
434        
435        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
436         * and columns.
437         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
438         * @return true iff the matrix is square
439         */
440        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
441                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
442        }
443        
444        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
445         * and columns.
446         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
447         * @return true iff the matrix is square
448         */
449        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
450                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
451        }
452        
453        /**
454         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
455         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
456         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
457         */
458        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
459                if (!isSquare(A)) {
460                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
461                }
462                final int n = A.length;
463                double[] diag = new double[n];
464                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
465                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
466                }
467                return diag;
468        }
469        
470        /**
471         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
472         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
473         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
474         */
475        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
476                if (!isSquare(A)) {
477                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
478                }
479                final int n = A.length;
480                float[] diag = new float[n];
481                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
482                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
483                }
484                return diag;
485        }
486        
487        /**
488         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
489         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
490         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
491         */
492        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
493                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
494        }
495        
496        /**
497         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
498         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
499         * 
500         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
501         * @return a diagonal matrix
502         */
503        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
504                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
505        }
506        
507        /**
508         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
509         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
510         * @return true if the matrix is singular
511         */
512        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
513                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
514                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
515                }       
516                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
517        }
518        
519        /**
520         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
521         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
522         * @return true if the matrix is singular
523         */
524        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
525                if (!A.isSquare()) {
526                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
527                }               
528                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
529                return !solver.isNonSingular();
530        }
531        
532        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
533        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
534        
535        /**
536         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
537         * using the specified relative tolerance.
538         * @param A a square matrix
539         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
540         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
541         */
542        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
543                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
544        }
545        
546        /**
547         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
548         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
549         * @param A a square matrix
550         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
551         */
552        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
553                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
554        }
555        
556        /**
557         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
558         * using the specified relative tolerance.
559         * @param A a square matrix
560         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
561         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
562         */
563        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
564                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
565        }
566        
567        /**
568         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
569         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
570         * @param A a square matrix
571         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
572         */
573        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
574                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
575        }
576        
577        /**
578         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
579         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
580         * 
581         * @param A a square matrix
582         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
583         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
584         */
585        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
586                try {
587                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
588                        return true;
589                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
590                return false;
591        }
592        
593        /**
594         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
595         * @param A a square matrix
596         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
597         */
598        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
599                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
600        }
601        
602        /**
603         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
604         * @param a first vector
605         * @param b second vector
606         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
607         */
608        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
609                return a.length == b.length;
610        }
611        
612        /**
613         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
614         * @param a first vector
615         * @param b second vector
616         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
617         */
618        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
619                return a.length == b.length;
620        }
621        
622        /**
623         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
624         * @param A first matrix
625         * @param B second matrix
626         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
627         */
628        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
629                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
630        }
631        
632        /**
633         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
634         * @param A first matrix
635         * @param B second matrix
636         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
637         */
638        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
639                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
640        }
641
642        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
643
644        
645        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] x) {
646                return x.clone();
647        }
648        
649        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] x) {
650                return x.clone();
651        }
652
653        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
654                final int m = A.length;
655                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
656                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
657                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
658                }
659                return B;
660        }
661        
662        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
663                final int m = A.length;
664                float[][] B = new float[m][];
665                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
666                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
667                }
668                return B;
669        }
670        
671        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
672        
673        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] x) {
674                final int m = x.length;
675                final float[] B = new float[m];
676                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
677                        B[i] = (float) x[i];
678                }
679                return B;
680        }
681        
682        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
683                final int m = A.length;
684                final int n = A[0].length;
685                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
686                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
687                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
688                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
689                        }
690                }
691                return B;
692        }
693        
694        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] x) {
695                final int m = x.length;
696                final double[] B = new double[m];
697                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
698                        B[i] = x[i];
699                }
700                return B;
701        }
702        
703        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
704                final int m = A.length;
705                final int n = A[0].length;
706                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
707                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
708                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
709                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
710                        }
711                }
712                return B;
713        }
714        
715        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
716        
717        /**
718         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
719         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
720         * @param val the fill value
721         */
722        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
723                Arrays.fill(x, val);
724        }
725        
726        /**
727         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
728         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
729         * @param val the fill value
730         */
731        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
732                Arrays.fill(x, val);
733        }
734        
735        /**
736         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
737         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
738         * @param val the fill value
739         */
740        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
741                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
742                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
743                }
744        }
745        
746        /**
747         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
748         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
749         * @param val the fill value
750         */
751        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
752                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
753                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
754                }
755        }
756        
757
758        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
759        
760        /**
761         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
762         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
763         * different lengths.
764         * None of the arguments is modified.
765         * @param a the first vector
766         * @param b the second vector
767         * @return a new {@code double} vector
768         */
769        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
770                double[] c = b.clone();
771                addD(a, c);
772                return c;
773        }
774        
775        /**
776         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
777         * to the second vector (destructively).
778         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
779         * different lengths.
780         * The second vector is modified.
781         * @param a the first vector
782         * @param b the second vector
783         */
784        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
785                if (!sameSize(a, b))
786                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
787                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
788                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
789                }
790        }
791        
792        /**
793         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
794         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
795         * different lengths.
796         * None of the arguments is modified.
797         * @param a the first vector
798         * @param b the second vector
799         * @return a new {@code float} vector
800         */
801        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
802                float[] c = b.clone();
803                addD(a, c);
804                return c;
805        }
806        
807        /**
808         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
809         * to the second vector (destructively).
810         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
811         * The second vector is modified.
812         * @param a the first vector
813         * @param b the second vector
814         */
815        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
816                if (!sameSize(a, b))
817                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
818                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
819                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
820                }
821        }
822
823        /**
824         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
825         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
826         * different size.
827         * None of the arguments is modified.
828         * @param A the first matrix
829         * @param B the second matrix
830         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
831         */
832        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
833                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
834                addD(A, C);
835                return C;
836        }
837        
838        /**
839         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
840         * to the second vector (destructively).
841         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
842         * different size.
843         * The second matrix is modified.
844         * @param A the first matrix
845         * @param B the second matrix
846         */
847        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
848                if (!sameSize(A, B))
849                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
850                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
851                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
852                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
853                        }
854                }
855        }
856        
857        /**
858         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
859         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
860         * different size.
861         * None of the arguments is modified.
862         * @param A the first matrix
863         * @param B the second matrix
864         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
865         */
866        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
867                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
868                addD(A, C);
869                return C;
870        }
871        
872        /**
873         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
874         * to the second vector (destructively).
875         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
876         * different size.
877         * The second matrix is modified.
878         * @param A the first matrix
879         * @param B the second matrix
880         */
881        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
882                if (!sameSize(A, B))
883                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
884                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
885                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
886                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
887                        }
888                }
889        }
890        
891        // ------------------------------------------------
892        
893        /**
894         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
895         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
896         * different lengths.
897         * None of the arguments is modified.
898         * @param a the first vector
899         * @param b the second vector
900         * @return a new {@code double} vector
901         */
902        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
903                if (!sameSize(a, b))
904                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
905                final int n = a.length;
906                double[] c = new double[n];
907                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
908                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
909                }
910                return c;
911        }
912        
913        // non-destructive a - b
914        /**
915         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
916         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
917         * different lengths.
918         * None of the arguments is modified.
919         * @param a the first vector
920         * @param b the second vector
921         * @return a new {@code float} vector
922         */
923        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
924                if (!sameSize(a, b))
925                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
926                final int n = a.length;
927                float[] c = new float[n];
928                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
929                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
930                }
931                return c;
932        }
933
934        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
935
936        // non-destructive
937        /**
938         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
939         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
940         * @param s a scalar
941         * @param x a vector
942         * @return a new vector
943         */
944        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
945                double[] b = x.clone();
946                multiplyD(s, b);
947                return b;
948        }
949        
950        // destructive
951        /**
952         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
953         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
954         * @param s a scalar
955         * @param x a vector
956         */
957        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
958                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
959                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
960                }
961        }
962        
963
964        // non-destructive
965        /**
966         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
967         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
968         * @param s a scalar
969         * @param A a matrix
970         * @return a new matrix
971         */
972        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
973                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
974                multiplyD(s, B);
975                return B;
976        }
977        
978        /**
979         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
980         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
981         * @param s a scalar
982         * @param A a matrix
983         */
984        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
985                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
986                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
987                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
988                        }
989                }
990        }
991        
992        // non-destructive
993        /**
994         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
995         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
996         * @param s a scalar
997         * @param x a vector
998         * @return a new vector
999         */
1000        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1001                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1002                multiplyD(s, B);
1003                return B;
1004        }
1005        
1006        // destructive
1007        /**
1008         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1009         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1010         * @param s a scalar
1011         * @param x a matrix
1012         */
1013        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1014                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1015                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1016                }
1017        }
1018
1019        // non-destructive
1020        /**
1021         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1022         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1023         * @param s a scalar
1024         * @param A a matrix
1025         * @return a new matrix
1026         */
1027        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1028                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1029                multiplyD(s, B);
1030                return B;
1031        }
1032        
1033        // destructive
1034        /**
1035         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1036         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1037         * @param s a scalar
1038         * @param A a matrix
1039         */
1040        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1041                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1042                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1043                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1044                        }
1045                }
1046        }
1047        
1048        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1049
1050        /**
1051         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1052         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1053         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1054         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1055         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1056         */
1057        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1058                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1059                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1060                return y;
1061        }
1062        
1063        /**
1064         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1065         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1066         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1067         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1068         */
1069        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1070                if (x == y) 
1071                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1072                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1073                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1074                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1075                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1076                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1077                        double s = 0;
1078                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1079                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1080                        }
1081                        y[i] = s;
1082                }
1083        }
1084
1085        /**
1086         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1087         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1088         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1089         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1090         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1091         */
1092        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1093                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1094                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1095                return y;
1096        }
1097        
1098        /**
1099         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1100         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1101         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1102         * which is modified.
1103         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1104         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1105         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1106         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1107         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1108         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1109         */
1110        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1111                if (x == y) 
1112                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1113                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1114                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1115                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1116                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1117                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1118                        double s = 0;
1119                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1120                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1121                        }
1122                        y[i] = s;
1123                }
1124        }
1125        
1126        /**
1127         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1128         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1129         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1130         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1131         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1132         */
1133        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1134                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1135                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1136                return y;
1137        }
1138        
1139        /**
1140         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1141         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1142         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1143         * which is modified.
1144         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1145         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1146         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1147         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1148         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1149         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1150         */
1151        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1152                if (x == y) 
1153                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1154                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1155                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1156                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1157                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1158                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1159                        double s = 0;
1160                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1161                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1162                        }
1163                        y[i] = (float) s;
1164                }
1165        }
1166        
1167
1168        
1169        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1170        
1171        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1172        /**
1173         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1174         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1175         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1176         * @param A first matrix
1177         * @param B second matrix
1178         * @return the matrix product A * B
1179         */
1180        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1181                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1182                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1183                if (nA != mB)
1184                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1185                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1186                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1187                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1188                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1189                return C;
1190        }
1191        
1192        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1193        /**
1194         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1195         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1196         * which is modified (destructively).
1197         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1198         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1199         * @param A first matrix
1200         * @param B second matrix
1201         * @param C the result matrix
1202         */
1203        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1204                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1205                if (A == C || B == C) 
1206                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1207                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1208                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1209                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1210                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1211                if (nA != mB)
1212                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1213                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1214                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1215                
1216                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1217                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1218                                double s = 0;
1219                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1220                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1221                                }
1222                                C[i][j] = s;
1223                        }
1224                }
1225        }
1226        
1227        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1228        /**
1229         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1230         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1231         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1232         * @param A first matrix
1233         * @param B second matrix
1234         * @return the matrix product A * B
1235         */
1236        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1237                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1238                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1239                if (nA != mB)
1240                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1241                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1242                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1243                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1244                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1245                return C;
1246        }
1247
1248        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1249        /**
1250         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1251         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1252         * which is modified (destructively).
1253         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1254         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1255         * @param A first matrix
1256         * @param B second matrix
1257         * @param C the result matrix
1258         */
1259        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1260                if (A == C || B == C) 
1261                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1262                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1263                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1264                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1265                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1266                if (nA != mB)
1267                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1268                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1269                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1270                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1271                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1272                                float s = 0;
1273                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1274                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1275                                }
1276                                C[i][j] = s;
1277                        }
1278                }
1279        }
1280        
1281        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1282        
1283        /**
1284         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1285         * which must have the same length.
1286         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1287         * @param x first vector
1288         * @param y second vector
1289         * @return the dot product
1290         */
1291        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1292                if (!sameSize(x, y))
1293                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1294                double sum = 0;
1295                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1296                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
1297                }
1298                return sum;
1299        }
1300        
1301        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1302        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1303        /**
1304         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1305         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1306         * m is the length of the second vector.
1307         * @param x first vector (of length m)
1308         * @param y second vector (of length n)
1309         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1310         */
1311        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1312                final int m = x.length;
1313                final int n = y.length;
1314                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1315                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1316                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1317                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
1318                        }
1319                }
1320                return M;
1321        }
1322
1323        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1324
1325        /**
1326         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1327         * @param x a vector
1328         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1329         */
1330        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
1331                double sum = 0;
1332                for (double val : x) {
1333                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1334                }
1335                return sum;
1336        }
1337        
1338        /**
1339         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1340         * @param x a vector
1341         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1342         */
1343        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
1344                double sum = 0;
1345                for (double val : x) {
1346                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1347                }
1348                return (float) sum;
1349        }
1350
1351        /**
1352         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1353         * @param x a vector
1354         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1355         */
1356        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
1357                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1358        }
1359
1360        /**
1361         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1362         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1363         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1364         * @param x a vector
1365         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1366         */
1367        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
1368                double sum = 0;
1369                for (double val : x) {
1370                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1371                }
1372                return sum;
1373        }
1374
1375        /**
1376         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1377         * @param x a vector
1378         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1379         */
1380        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1381                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1382        }
1383
1384        /**
1385         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1386         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1387         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1388         * @param x a vector
1389         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1390         */
1391        public static double normL2squared(final float[] x) {
1392                double sum = 0;
1393                for (double val : x) {
1394                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1395                }
1396                return sum;
1397        }
1398        
1399        // Normalize vectors
1400        
1401        /**
1402         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1403         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1404         * @param x a vector
1405         * @return the normalized vector
1406         */
1407        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
1408                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
1409                normalizeD(xx);
1410                return xx;
1411        }
1412        
1413        /**
1414         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1415         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1416         * @param x a vector
1417         */
1418        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
1419                double normx = normL2(x);
1420                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1421                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(x));
1422                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, x);
1423        }
1424        
1425        /**
1426         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1427         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1428         * @param x a vector
1429         * @return the normalized vector
1430         */
1431        public static float[] normalize(final float[] x) {
1432                float[] xx = duplicate(x);
1433                normalizeD(xx);
1434                return xx;
1435        }
1436        
1437        /**
1438         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1439         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1440         * @param x a vector
1441         */
1442        public static void normalizeD(final float[] x) {
1443                double normx = normL2(x);
1444                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1445                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1446                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), x);
1447        }
1448        
1449        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1450        
1451        /** 
1452         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1453         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1454         * number of elements.
1455         * @param x first vector
1456         * @param y second vector
1457         * @return the distance
1458         */
1459        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
1460                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1461        }
1462        
1463        /** 
1464         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1465         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1466         * number of elements.
1467         * @param x first vector
1468         * @param y second vector
1469         * @return the squared distance
1470         */
1471        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
1472                double sum = 0;
1473                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1474                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1475                }
1476                return sum;
1477        }
1478        
1479        /** 
1480         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1481         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1482         * number of elements.
1483         * @param x first vector
1484         * @param y second vector
1485         * @return the distance
1486         */
1487        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
1488                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1489        }
1490        
1491        /** 
1492         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1493         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1494         * number of elements.
1495         * @param x first vector
1496         * @param y second vector
1497         * @return the squared distance
1498         */
1499        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
1500                double sum = 0;
1501                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1502                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1503                }
1504                return (float) sum;
1505        }
1506        
1507        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1508        
1509        /**
1510         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1511         * @param A a matrix
1512         * @return the norm of the matrix
1513         */
1514        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1515                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1516                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1517                double s = 0;
1518                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1519                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1520                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1521                        }
1522                }
1523                return Math.sqrt(s);
1524        }
1525
1526        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1527
1528        /**
1529         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1530         * {@code double[]} vector.
1531         * @param x a vector
1532         * @return the sum of vector elements
1533         */
1534        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
1535                double sum = 0;
1536                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1537                        sum = sum + x[i];
1538                }
1539                return sum;
1540        }
1541        
1542        /**
1543         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1544         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1545         * @param A a matrix
1546         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1547         */
1548        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1549                double sum = 0;
1550                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1551                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1552                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1553                        }
1554                }
1555                return sum;
1556        }
1557        
1558        /**
1559         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1560         * {@code float[]} vector.
1561         * @param x a vector
1562         * @return the sum of vector elements
1563         */
1564        public static double sum(final float[] x) {
1565                double sum = 0;
1566                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1567                        sum = sum + x[i];
1568                }
1569                return sum;
1570        }
1571        
1572        /**
1573         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1574         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1575         * @param A a matrix
1576         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1577         */
1578        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1579                double sum = 0;
1580                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1581                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1582                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1583                        }
1584                }
1585                return sum;
1586        }
1587        
1588        // --------------------------------------------------
1589        
1590        /**
1591         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1592         * @param A a matrix
1593         * @param row the row index
1594         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1595         */
1596        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1597                return sum(A[row]);
1598        }
1599        
1600        /**
1601         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1602         * @param A a matrix
1603         * @param row the row index
1604         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1605         */
1606        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1607                return sum(A[row]);
1608        }
1609        
1610
1611        /**
1612         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1613         * @param A a matrix
1614         * @param col the column index
1615         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1616         */
1617        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1618                double sum = 0;
1619                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1620                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1621                }
1622                return sum;
1623        }
1624        
1625        /**
1626         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1627         * @param A a matrix
1628         * @param col the column index
1629         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1630         */
1631        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1632                double sum = 0;
1633                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1634                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1635                }
1636                return sum;
1637        }
1638        
1639        /**
1640         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1641         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1642         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1643         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1644         */
1645        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1646                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1647                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1648                        double sum = 0;
1649                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1650                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1651                        }
1652                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1653                }
1654                return sumVec;
1655        }
1656        
1657        /**
1658         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1659         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1660         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1661         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1662         */
1663        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1664                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1665                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1666                        double sum = 0;
1667                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1668                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1669                        }
1670                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1671                }
1672                return sumVec;
1673        }
1674        
1675        /**
1676         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1677         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1678         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1679         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1680         */
1681        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1682                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1683                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1684                        double sum = 0;
1685                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1686                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1687                        }
1688                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1689                }
1690                return sumVec;
1691        }
1692        
1693        /**
1694         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1695         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1696         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1697         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1698         */
1699        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1700                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1701                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1702                        double sum = 0;
1703                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1704                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1705                        }
1706                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1707                }
1708                return sumVec;
1709        }
1710        
1711        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1712        
1713        /**
1714         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1715         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1716         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1717         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1718         * 
1719         * @param x a vector
1720         * @return the index of the smallest value
1721         */
1722        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1723                if (x.length == 0)
1724                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1725                double minval = x[0];
1726                int minidx = 0;
1727                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1728                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1729                                minval = x[i];
1730                                minidx = i;
1731                        }
1732                }
1733                return minidx;
1734        }
1735        
1736        /**
1737         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1738         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1739         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1740         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1741         * 
1742         * @param x a vector
1743         * @return the index of the smallest value
1744         */
1745        public static int idxMin(float[] x) {
1746                if (x.length == 0)
1747                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1748                float minval = x[0];
1749                int minidx = 0;
1750                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1751                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1752                                minval = x[i];
1753                                minidx = i;
1754                        }
1755                }
1756                return minidx;
1757        }
1758        
1759        
1760        /**
1761         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1762         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1763         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1764         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1765         * 
1766         * @param x a vector
1767         * @return the index of the largest value
1768         */
1769        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1770                if (x.length == 0)
1771                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1772                double maxval = x[0];
1773                int maxidx = 0;
1774                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1775                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1776                                maxval = x[i];
1777                                maxidx = i;
1778                        }
1779                }
1780                return maxidx;
1781        }
1782        
1783        /**
1784         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1785         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1786         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1787         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1788         * 
1789         * @param x a vector
1790         * @return the index of the largest value
1791         */
1792        public static int idxMax(float[] x) {
1793                if (x.length == 0)
1794                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1795                float maxval = x[0];
1796                int maxidx = 0;
1797                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1798                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1799                                maxval = x[i];
1800                                maxidx = i;
1801                        }
1802                }
1803                return maxidx;
1804        }
1805        
1806        
1807        /**
1808         * Returns the smallest value in the
1809         * specified vector. 
1810         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1811         * @param x a vector
1812         * @return the largest value
1813         */
1814        public static float min(final float[] x) {
1815                if (x.length == 0)
1816                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1817                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1818                for (float val : x) {
1819                        if (val < minval) {
1820                                minval = val;
1821                        }
1822                }
1823                return minval;
1824        }
1825        
1826        /**
1827         * Returns the smallest value in the
1828         * specified vector. 
1829         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1830         * @param x a vector
1831         * @return the largest value
1832         */
1833        public static double min(final double[] x) {
1834                if (x.length == 0)
1835                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1836                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1837                for (double val : x) {
1838                        if (val < minval) {
1839                                minval = val;
1840                        }
1841                }
1842                return minval;
1843        }
1844        
1845        /**
1846         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1847         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1848         * @param x a vector
1849         * @return the largest value
1850         */
1851        public static double max(final double[] x) {
1852                if (x.length == 0)
1853                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1854                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1855                for (double val : x) {
1856                        if (val > maxval) {
1857                                maxval = val;
1858                        }
1859                }
1860                return maxval;
1861        }
1862
1863        /**
1864         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1865         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1866         * @param x a vector
1867         * @return the largest value
1868         */
1869        public static float max(final float[] x) {
1870                if (x.length == 0)
1871                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1872                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1873                for (float val : x) {
1874                        if (val > maxval) {
1875                                maxval = val;
1876                        }
1877                }
1878                return maxval;
1879        }
1880        
1881        /**
1882         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1883         * @param A a matrix
1884         * @return the largest matrix value
1885         */
1886        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1887                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1888                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1889                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1890                                if (val > maxval) {
1891                                        maxval = val;
1892                                }
1893                        }
1894                }
1895                return maxval;
1896        }
1897        
1898        /**
1899         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
1900         * @param A a matrix
1901         * @return the largest matrix value
1902         */
1903        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1904                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1905                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1906                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1907                                if (val > maxval) {
1908                                        maxval = val;
1909                                }
1910                        }
1911                }
1912                return maxval;
1913        }
