1914        
1915        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1916        
1917        /**
1918         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1919         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1920         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1921         */
1922        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1923                int n = 0;
1924                for (float[] x : xs) {
1925                        n = n + x.length;
1926                }
1927                float[] va = new float[n];
1928                int j = 0;
1929                for (float[] x : xs) {
1930                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1931                                va[j] = x[i];
1932                                j++;
1933                        }
1934                }               
1935                return va;
1936        }
1937
1938        /**
1939         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1940         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1941         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1942         */
1943        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1944                int n = 0;
1945                for (double[] x : xs) {
1946                        n = n + x.length;
1947                }
1948                double[] va = new double[n];    
1949                int j = 0;
1950                for (double[] x : xs) {
1951                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1952                                va[j] = x[i];
1953                                j++;
1954                        }
1955                }               
1956                return va;
1957        }
1958        
1959        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1960        
1961        /**
1962         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1963         * which must have the same length.
1964         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1965         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1966         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1967         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1968         * @return the interpolated vector
1969         */
1970        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1971                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
1972                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1973                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1974                }
1975                return c;
1976        }
1977        
1978        /**
1979         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1980         * which must have the same length.
1981         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1982         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1983         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1984         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1985         * @return the interpolated vector
1986         */
1987        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1988                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
1989                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1990                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1991                }
1992                return c;
1993        }
1994        
1995        
1996        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1997        
1998        /**
1999         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2000         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2001         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2002         * specified Cartesian vector.
2003         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2004         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
2005         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2006         */
2007        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
2008                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
2009                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
2010                        xh[i] = xc[i];
2011                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2012                }
2013                return xh;
2014        }
2015        
2016        /**
2017         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2018         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2019         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2020         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
2021         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2022         */
2023        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
2024                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
2025                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
2026                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2027                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2028                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
2029                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
2030                }
2031                return xc;
2032        }
2033        
2034        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2035        
2036        /**
2037         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2038         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2039         * @param A a square matrix
2040         * @return the determinant
2041         */
2042        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2043                if (!A.isSquare())
2044                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2045                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2046        }
2047        
2048        /**
2049         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2050         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2051         * @param A a square matrix
2052         * @return the determinant
2053         */
2054        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2055                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2056        }
2057        
2058        /**
2059         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2060         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2061         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2062         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2063         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2064         * @return the determinant
2065         */
2066        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2067                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2068                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2069                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2070        }
2071        
2072        /**
2073         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2074         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2075         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2076         * @return the determinant
2077         */
2078        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2079                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2080                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2081                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2082        }
2083        
2084
2085        /**
2086         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2087         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2088         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2089         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2090         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2091         * @return the determinant
2092         */
2093        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2094                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2095                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2096                return 
2097                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2098                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2099                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2100                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2101                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2102                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2103        }
2104        
2105        /**
2106         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2107         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2108         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2109         * @return the determinant
2110         */
2111        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2112                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2113                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2114                return
2115                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2116                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2117                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2118                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2119                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2120                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2121        }
2122
2123
2124        
2125        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2126        
2127        /**
2128         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2129         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2130         * @param A a square matrix
2131         * @return the trace 
2132         */
2133        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2134                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2135                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2136                if (m != n) 
2137                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2138                double s = 0;
2139                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2140                                s = s + A[i][i];
2141                }
2142                return s;
2143        }
2144        
2145        /**
2146         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2147         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2148         * @param A a square matrix
2149         * @return the trace 
2150         */
2151        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2152                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2153                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2154                if (m != n) 
2155                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2156                double s = 0;
2157                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2158                                s = s + A[i][i];
2159                }
2160                return (float) s;
2161        }
2162        
2163        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2164        
2165        /**
2166         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2167         * The original matrix is not modified.
2168         * @param A a matrix
2169         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2170         */
2171        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2172                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2173                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2174                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2175                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2176                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2177                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2178                        }
2179                }
2180                return At;
2181        }
2182        
2183        /**
2184         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2185         * The original matrix is not modified.
2186         * @param A a matrix
2187         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2188         */
2189        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2190                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2191                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2192                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2193                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2194                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2195                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2196                        }
2197                }
2198                return At;
2199        }
2200

2202        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2203        
2204        /**
2205         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2206         * using the specified tolerance value.
2207         * @param x a vector
2208         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2209         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2210         */
2211        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
2212                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2213                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2214                                return false;
2215                        }
2216                }
2217                return true;
2218        }
2219        
2220        /**
2221         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2222         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2223         * @param x a vector
2224         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2225         */
2226        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
2227                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2228        }
2229        
2230        /**
2231         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2232         * using the specified tolerance value.
2233         * @param x a vector
2234         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2235         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2236         */
2237        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
2238                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2239                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2240                                return false;
2241                        }
2242                }
2243                return true;
2244        }
2245        
2246        /**
2247         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2248         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2249         * @param x a vector
2250         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2251         */
2252        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
2253                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2254        }
2255        
2256        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2257        
2258        /**
2259         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2260         * using the specified tolerance value.
2261         * @param A a matrix
2262         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2263         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2264         */
2265        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2266                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2267                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2268                                return false;
2269                        }
2270                }
2271                return true;
2272        }
2273        
2274        /**
2275         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2276         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2277         * @param A a matrix
2278         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2279         */
2280        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2281                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2282        }

2284        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2285        
2286        public static double[] sort(double[] x) {
2287                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2288                Arrays.sort(y);
2289                return y;
2290        }
2291        
2292        public static float[] sort(float[] x) {
2293                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2294                Arrays.sort(y);
2295                return y;
2296        }

2298        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2299        
2300        /**
2301         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2302         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2303         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2304         * @param A a square matrix
2305         * @return the inverse matrix
2306         */
2307        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2308                if (!isSquare(A))
2309                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2310                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2311                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2312        }
2313        
2314        /**
2315         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2316         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2317         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2318         * @param A a square matrix
2319         * @return the inverse matrix
2320         */
2321        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2322                if (!isSquare(A))
2323                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2324                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2325                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2326        }
2327
2328        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2329        
2330        /**
2331         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2332         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2333         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2334         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2335         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2336         * 
2337         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2338         * @param b a vector of length n
2339         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2340         */
2341        
2342        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2343                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2344                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2345        }
2346        
2347        /**
2348         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2349         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2350         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2351         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2352         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2353         * 
2354         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2355         * @param b a vector of length n
2356         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2357         */
2358        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2359                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2360                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2361                }
2362                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2363                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2364                }
2365//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2366                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2367                RealVector x = null;
2368                try {
2369                        x = solver.solve(b);
2370                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2371                return x;
2372        }
2373        
2374        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2375        
2376        public static String toString(double[] x) {
2377                if (x == null) {
2378                        return String.valueOf(x);
2379                }
2380                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2381                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2382                printToStream(x, strm);
2383                return bas.toString();
2384        }
2385        
2386        public static String toString(float[] x) {
2387                if (x == null) {
2388                        return String.valueOf(x);
2389                }
2390                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2391                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2392                printToStream(x, strm);
2393                return bas.toString();
2394        }
2395        
2396        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2397                if (A == null) {
2398                        return String.valueOf(A);
2399                }
2400                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2401                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2402                printToStream(A, strm);
2403                return bas.toString();
2404        }
2405        
2406        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
2407                if (A == null) {
2408                        return String.valueOf(A);
2409                }
2410                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2411                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2412                printToStream(A, strm);
2413                return bas.toString();
2414        }
2415        
2416        public static String toString(RealVector x) {
2417                if (x == null) {
2418                        return String.valueOf(x);
2419                }
2420                else {
2421                        return toString(x.toArray());
2422                }
2423        }
2424        
2425        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
2426                if (A == null) {
2427                        return String.valueOf(A);
2428                }
2429                else {
2430                        return toString(A.getData());
2431                }
2432        }
2433        
2434        // --------------------
2435        
2436        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
2437                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2438                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2439                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2440                        if (i > 0)
2441                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2442                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
2443                }
2444                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2445                strm.flush();
2446        }
2447        
2448        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2449                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2450                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2451                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2452                        if (i == 0)
2453                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2454                        else
2455                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2456                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2457                                if (j == 0) 
2458                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2459                                else
2460                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2461                        }
2462                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2463                }
2464                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2465                strm.flush();
2466        }
2467        
2468        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
2469                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2470                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2471                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
2472                        if (i > 0)
2473                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2474                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
2475                }
2476                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2477                strm.flush();
2478        }
2479        
2480        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2481                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2482                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2483                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2484                        if (i == 0)
2485                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2486                        else
2487                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2488                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2489                                if (j == 0) 
2490                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2491                                else
2492                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2493                        }
2494                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2495                }
2496                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2497                strm.flush();
2498        }

2500        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2501        
2502        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
2503                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2504                
2505                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2506                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2507                }
2508        }
2509        
2510        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2511                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2512                
2513                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2514                        super("square matrix expected");
2515                }
2516        }
2517        
2518        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2519                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2520                
2521                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2522                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2523                }
2524        }
2525        
2526        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
2527                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2528                
2529                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2530                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
2531                }
2532        }
